Advisory Jury.definition: a jury impaneled at the discretion of a trial judge to assist the judge in deciding a case NOTE

1.1: a jury impaneled at the discretion of a trial judge to assist the judge in deciding a case
1.note: Advisory juries are allowed in cases in which there is no right to a jury or in which the right to a jury has been waived. The judge may follow or disregard the advisory jury's verdict.
